<hr />
<div id="blog-corpo">	
	<div id="content" class="narrowcolumn">
			
			<div class="post" id="post-1746">
				<h2><a href="http://g1.globo.com/platb/paulocoelho/2010/06/30/a-reflexao-11/" rel="bookmark" class="icone paulocoelho" title="Link Permanente para A reflexão">A reflexão</a></h2>
			<p>
				<small>
					<div class="time">qua, 30/06/10</div>
					<div class="auto">por Paulo Coelho |</div>
					<div class="cate">categoria <a href="http://g1.globo.com/platb/paulocoelho/category/uncategorized/" title="Ver todos os posts em Todas" rel="category tag">Todas</a></div>
					<div class="tags2"></div>
				</small>
			</p>

			
			<div class="entry"><p>De Frederick Buechner (The magnificent defeat):</p>
<p>Nós já dialogamos naturalmente com Deus, através da oração. Rezar é quebrar o silêncio. E a necessidade de reconhecer e ser reconhecido. Rezar é o som criado pelo mais profundo de nossos sentimentos.</p>
<p>Eu não estou falando apenas das preces formais que costumamos dizer na igreja ou no quarto, antes de dormir. Eu falo daqueles vestígios, fragmentos de oração que as pessoas usam, mesmo dizendo que não acreditam em nada, sem sequer se darem conta de que estão rezando. Algo inesperado acontece, e as pessoas dizem Meu Deus!, ou então, Nossa Senhora!, e ali está uma prece, muitas vezes escondida, proferida com vergonha, medo do ridículo, escondida sob a forma de blasfêmia.</p>
<p>A oração é um instinto humano de se abrir naquilo que tem de mais profundo. É impossível evitar este instinto. De uma maneira ou de outra, todas as pessoas rezam e rezaram deste o início dos tempos.</p>
</div>

			<p class="postmetadata"> <a href="http://g1.globo.com/platb/paulocoelho/2010/06/30/a-reflexao-11/#comments" title="Comentário para A reflexão">37 comentários &#187;</a></p>
			</div>

		
			<div class="post" id="post-1745">
				<h2><a href="http://g1.globo.com/platb/paulocoelho/2010/06/29/o-viajante-silencioso/" rel="bookmark" class="icone paulocoelho" title="Link Permanente para O viajante silencioso">O viajante silencioso</a></h2>
			<p>
				<small>
					<div class="time">ter, 29/06/10</div>
					<div class="auto">por Paulo Coelho |</div>
					<div class="cate">categoria <a href="http://g1.globo.com/platb/paulocoelho/category/uncategorized/" title="Ver todos os posts em Todas" rel="category tag">Todas</a></div>
					<div class="tags2"></div>
				</small>
			</p>

			
			<div class="entry"><p>O governador e sua comitiva estavam em um trem, quando notaram, no mesmo vagão, um senhor mal-vestido, com os olhos fechados. Alguém resolveu afastá-lo dali, mas o governador impediu; aquela criatura serviria para distraí-los durante a viagem.</p>
<p>Provocaram o homem durante todo o trajeto, com gracejos e humilhações.</p>
<p>Quando chegaram à estação, porém, viram que muita gente viera receber o estranho: tratava-se de um dos mais conhecidos rabinos da América, e seus seguidores tinham ajudado a eleger o governador.</p>
<p>Imediatamente, este se deu conta do erro. Puxando-o para um canto, pediu:</p>
<p>Perdoa as nossas brincadeiras e abençoa-nos, rabino.</p>
<p>Eu posso abençoá-lo, mas não posso perdoá-lo. Naquele trem, eu estava, sem querer, representando todos os homens humildes deste mundo. Para receber o perdão, percorra a terra inteira, e se ajoelhe diante de cada um deles.</p>
</div>

			<p class="postmetadata"> <a href="http://g1.globo.com/platb/paulocoelho/2010/06/29/o-viajante-silencioso/#comments" title="Comentário para O viajante silencioso">17 comentários &#187;</a></p>
			</div>

		
			<div class="post" id="post-1743">
				<h2><a href="http://g1.globo.com/platb/paulocoelho/2010/06/28/do-abismo/" rel="bookmark" class="icone paulocoelho" title="Link Permanente para Do abismo">Do abismo</a></h2>
			<p>
				<small>
					<div class="time">seg, 28/06/10</div>
					<div class="auto">por Paulo Coelho |</div>
					<div class="cate">categoria <a href="http://g1.globo.com/platb/paulocoelho/category/uncategorized/" title="Ver todos os posts em Todas" rel="category tag">Todas</a></div>
					<div class="tags2"></div>
				</small>
			</p>

			
			<div class="entry"><p>O guerreiro  sem querer  dá um passo em falso e  mergulha no abismo. Os fantasmas se aproximam e o assustam, a solidão o atormenta. Como tem fé, e sempre procurou seguir o caminho do Bom Combate, não pensava que isto fosse acontecer com ele.</p>
<p>Mas aconteceu. Os desígnios da Providência Divina são insondáveis. Envolto pela escuridão, ele se comunica com seu mestre.</p>
<p>&#8220;Mestre, caí no abismo&#8221;, diz ele. &#8220;As águas são fundas e escuras; será que morrerei afogado?&#8221;</p>
<p>&#8220;Lembre-se de uma coisa&#8221;, ele escuta o mestre dizer. &#8220;O que afoga alguém não é o mergulho, mas o fato de permanecer debaixo d&#8217;água&#8221;.</p>
<p>E o guerreiro,  a partir deste momento, usa as suas forças para sair do abismo.</p>
</div>

			<p class="postmetadata"> <a href="http://g1.globo.com/platb/paulocoelho/2010/06/28/do-abismo/#comments" title="Comentário para Do abismo">21 comentários &#187;</a></p>
			</div>

		
			<div class="post" id="post-1741">
				<h2><a href="http://g1.globo.com/platb/paulocoelho/2010/06/27/transparente-e-secreto/" rel="bookmark" class="icone paulocoelho" title="Link Permanente para Transparente e secreto">Transparente e secreto</a></h2>
			<p>
				<small>
					<div class="time">dom, 27/06/10</div>
					<div class="auto">por Paulo Coelho |</div>
					<div class="cate">categoria <a href="http://g1.globo.com/platb/paulocoelho/category/uncategorized/" title="Ver todos os posts em Todas" rel="category tag">Todas</a></div>
					<div class="tags2"></div>
				</small>
			</p>

			
			<div class="entry"><p>O guerreiro sabe que nenhum homem é uma ilha, isolada no meio do oceano.</p>
<p>Sabe que não pode lutar sozinho; seja qual for o seu plano, sempre depende de outras pessoas. Precisa discutir sua estratégia, pedir ajuda, e  nos momentos de descanso  ter alguém para contar histórias de combate ao redor da fogueira.</p>
<p>Mas ele não deixa que as pessoas confundam sua  camaradagem com insegurança. Ele e transparente em suas ações, e secreto nos seus planos.</p>
<p>Um guerreiro da luz dança com seus companheiros, mas não transfere para ninguém a  responsabilidade de seus passos.</p>
</div>

			<p class="postmetadata"> <a href="http://g1.globo.com/platb/paulocoelho/2010/06/27/transparente-e-secreto/#comments" title="Comentário para Transparente e secreto">25 comentários &#187;</a></p>
			</div>

		
			<div class="post" id="post-1740">
				<h2><a href="http://g1.globo.com/platb/paulocoelho/2010/06/26/meditando-no-ataque/" rel="bookmark" class="icone paulocoelho" title="Link Permanente para Meditando no ataque">Meditando no ataque</a></h2>
			<p>
				<small>
					<div class="time">sáb, 26/06/10</div>
					<div class="auto">por Paulo Coelho |</div>
					<div class="cate">categoria <a href="http://g1.globo.com/platb/paulocoelho/category/uncategorized/" title="Ver todos os posts em Todas" rel="category tag">Todas</a></div>
					<div class="tags2"></div>
				</small>
			</p>

			
			<div class="entry"><p>O guerreiro da luz sempre procura melhorar.</p>
<p>Cada golpe de sua espada traz consigo séculos de sabedoria e meditação.</p>
<p>Cada golpe precisa ter a força, e a habilidade de todos os guerreiros do passado, que ainda hoje continuam abençoando a luta.</p>
<p>Cada movimento no combate honra os movimentos que as gerações anteriores procuraram  transmitir através da tradição.</p>
<p>O guerreiro desenvolve a beleza de seus golpes, não para destruir seu adversário, mas para honrar os amigos que lhe ensinaram a arte da espada.</p>
</div>

			<p class="postmetadata"> <a href="http://g1.globo.com/platb/paulocoelho/2010/06/26/meditando-no-ataque/#comments" title="Comentário para Meditando no ataque">15 comentários &#187;</a></p>
			</div>

		
			<div class="post" id="post-1739">
				<h2><a href="http://g1.globo.com/platb/paulocoelho/2010/06/25/sabendo-esperar-2/" rel="bookmark" class="icone paulocoelho" title="Link Permanente para Sabendo esperar">Sabendo esperar</a></h2>
			<p>
				<small>
					<div class="time">sex, 25/06/10</div>
					<div class="auto">por Paulo Coelho |</div>
					<div class="cate">categoria <a href="http://g1.globo.com/platb/paulocoelho/category/uncategorized/" title="Ver todos os posts em Todas" rel="category tag">Todas</a></div>
					<div class="tags2"></div>
				</small>
			</p>

			
			<div class="entry"><p>O guerreiro da luz precisa de tempo para si mesmo. E usa este tempo para o descanso, a contemplação, o contato com a alma do mundo. Mesmo no meio de um combate, ele consegue meditar.</p>
<p>Em algumas ocasiões o guerreiro senta-se, relaxa, e deixa que tudo que está acontecendo ao seu redor continue acontecendo. Olha tudo a sua volta como se fosse um espectador, não tenta crescer nem diminuir &#8211; apenas entregar-se sem resistência ao movimento da vida.</p>
<p>Aos poucos, tudo que parecia complicado começa a tornar-se simples. E o guerreiro se alegra.</p>
</div>

			<p class="postmetadata"> <a href="http://g1.globo.com/platb/paulocoelho/2010/06/25/sabendo-esperar-2/#comments" title="Comentário para Sabendo esperar">24 comentários &#187;</a></p>
			</div>

		
			<div class="post" id="post-1738">
				<h2><a href="http://g1.globo.com/platb/paulocoelho/2010/06/24/dos-detalhes-2/" rel="bookmark" class="icone paulocoelho" title="Link Permanente para Dos detalhes">Dos detalhes</a></h2>
			<p>
				<small>
					<div class="time">qui, 24/06/10</div>
					<div class="auto">por Paulo Coelho |</div>
					<div class="cate">categoria <a href="http://g1.globo.com/platb/paulocoelho/category/uncategorized/" title="Ver todos os posts em Todas" rel="category tag">Todas</a></div>
					<div class="tags2"></div>
				</small>
			</p>

			
			<div class="entry"><p>O guerreiro da luz presta atenção nas pequenas coisas. Porque elas podem atrapalhar os grandes avanços.</p>
<p>Um espinho, por menor que seja, faz o viajante interromper seu passo. Uma pequena célula &#8211; invisível aos nossos olhos &#8211; pode enlouquecer e destruir todo um organismo sadio. A lembrança de um instante de medo pode nos transformar em covardes a cada manhã. Um momento de hesitação no meio do combate pode abrir a guarda para o golpe fatal do inimigo.</p>
<p>O guerreiro está atento às pequenas coisas. Ele às vezes é duro demais consigo mesmo, mas prefere agir desta maneira.</p>
<p>O diabo mora nos detalhes, diz um velho provérbio. Um guerreiro jamais esquece isto.</p>
</div>

			<p class="postmetadata"> <a href="http://g1.globo.com/platb/paulocoelho/2010/06/24/dos-detalhes-2/#comments" title="Comentário para Dos detalhes">21 comentários &#187;</a></p>
			</div>

		
			<div class="post" id="post-1737">
				<h2><a href="http://g1.globo.com/platb/paulocoelho/2010/06/23/do-medo-3/" rel="bookmark" class="icone paulocoelho" title="Link Permanente para Do medo">Do medo</a></h2>
			<p>
				<small>
					<div class="time">qua, 23/06/10</div>
					<div class="auto">por Paulo Coelho |</div>
					<div class="cate">categoria <a href="http://g1.globo.com/platb/paulocoelho/category/uncategorized/" title="Ver todos os posts em Todas" rel="category tag">Todas</a></div>
					<div class="tags2"></div>
				</small>
			</p>

			
			<div class="entry"><p>O guerreiro da luz fica apavorado, quando precisa tomar deci¬sões importantes.</p>
<p>Isto é grande demais para você, diz um amigo em quem confia. Vá em frente, tenha coragem, diz outro amigo em quem confia. E suas dúvidas aumentam.</p>
<p>Depois de alguns dias de angústia, ele recorre ao melhor con¬selheiro de todos: o escuro do seu quarto.</p>
<p>Nas sombras, ele vê a si mesmo no futuro. Vê as pessoas que serão beneficiadas e preju¬dicadas por sua atitude. Sabe que, ao dar um passo adiante, deixará alguma coisa &#8211; ou alguém &#8211; para trás. Ele não quer causar sofrimentos inúteis, mas tampouco quer abandonar o caminho.</p>
<p>O guerreiro que observa a si mesmo deixa que a decisão se manifeste. Se for preciso dizer sim, ele dirá com coragem. Se for preciso dizer não, ele dirá sem covardia.</p>
</div>

			<p class="postmetadata"> <a href="http://g1.globo.com/platb/paulocoelho/2010/06/23/do-medo-3/#comments" title="Comentário para Do medo">33 comentários &#187;</a></p>
			</div>

		
			<div class="post" id="post-1736">
				<h2><a href="http://g1.globo.com/platb/paulocoelho/2010/06/22/o-medo-e-o-desejo/" rel="bookmark" class="icone paulocoelho" title="Link Permanente para O medo e o desejo">O medo e o desejo</a></h2>
			<p>
				<small>
					<div class="time">ter, 22/06/10</div>
					<div class="auto">por Paulo Coelho |</div>
					<div class="cate">categoria <a href="http://g1.globo.com/platb/paulocoelho/category/uncategorized/" title="Ver todos os posts em Todas" rel="category tag">Todas</a></div>
					<div class="tags2"></div>
				</small>
			</p>

			
			<div class="entry"><p>O guerreiro da luz contempla as duas colunas que estão ao lado da porta que pretende abrir. Uma se chama Medo, outra se chama Desejo.</p>
<p>O guerreiro olha para a coluna do Medo, e ali está escrito: você vai entrar num mundo desconhecido e perigoso, onde tudo que aprendeu até agora não servirá para nada.</p>
<p>O guerreiro olha para a coluna do Desejo, e ali está escrito: você vai sair de um mundo conhecido, onde estão guardadas as coisas que sempre quis, e pelas quais lutou tanto.</p>
<p>O guerreiro sorri &#8211; porque não existe nada que o assuste, e nada que o prenda. Com a segurança de quem sabe o que quer, ele abre a porta.</p>
</div>

			<p class="postmetadata"> <a href="http://g1.globo.com/platb/paulocoelho/2010/06/22/o-medo-e-o-desejo/#comments" title="Comentário para O medo e o desejo">20 comentários &#187;</a></p>
			</div>

		
			<div class="post" id="post-1735">
				<h2><a href="http://g1.globo.com/platb/paulocoelho/2010/06/21/da-crianca-4/" rel="bookmark" class="icone paulocoelho" title="Link Permanente para Da criança">Da criança</a></h2>
			<p>
				<small>
					<div class="time">seg, 21/06/10</div>
					<div class="auto">por Paulo Coelho |</div>
					<div class="cate">categoria <a href="http://g1.globo.com/platb/paulocoelho/category/uncategorized/" title="Ver todos os posts em Todas" rel="category tag">Todas</a></div>
					<div class="tags2"></div>
				</small>
			</p>

			
			<div class="entry"><p>O guerreiro da luz acredita. Assim como as crianças &#8211; nas quais sempre se espelha &#8211; o guerreiro é todo entusiasmo.</p>
<p>Ao contrário das outras pessoas, que estão sempre exigindo provas, o guerreiro da luz acha que uma coisa é verdade até que alguém consiga demonstrar que é mentira.</p>
<p>Porque crê em milagres, os milagres começam a acontecer. Porque tem certeza que seu pensamento pode mudar sua vida, sua vida começa a mudar. Porque está certo que irá encontrar o amor, este amor termina aparecendo.</p>
<p>De vez em quando, ele se decepciona. Às vezes, ele se machuca. E então escuta os comentários: como é ingênuo!</p>
<p>Mas o guerreiro sabe que vale o preço. Para cada decepção, tem duas conquistas a seu favor. Todos os que acreditam sem medo, sabem disso.</p>
</div>

			<p class="postmetadata"> <a href="http://g1.globo.com/platb/paulocoelho/2010/06/21/da-crianca-4/#comments" title="Comentário para Da criança">32 comentários &#187;</a></p>
			</div>

				<div class="navigation">
			<div class="alignleft"><a href="http://g1.globo.com/platb/paulocoelho/2010/06/page/2/" >&laquo; posts anteriores</a></div>
			<div class="alignright"></div>
		</div>

	
	</div>

class="tabela-pontos-ultimos-jogos"><span class="tabela-icone tabela-icone-circulo tabela-icone-d"></span><span class="tabela-icone tabela-icone-circulo tabela-icone-e"></span><span class="tabela-icone tabela-icone-circulo tabela-icone-v"></span><span class="tabela-icone tabela-icone-circulo tabela-icone-v"></span><span class="tabela-icone tabela-icone-circulo tabela-icone-v"></span></td></tr><tr class="tabela-body-linha"><td class="tabela-pontos-ponto">12</td><td>9</td><td>3</td><td>3</td><td>3</td><td>10</td><td>11</td><td>-1</td><td>44.4</td><td class="tabela-pontos-ultimos-jogos"><span class="tabela-icone tabela-icone-circulo tabela-icone-v"></span><span class="tabela-icone tabela-icone-circulo tabela-icone-d"></span><span class="tabela-icone" style="background-color:#0000ff;"></span> Classificados</span><span class="legenda-label"><span class="tabela-icone" style="background-color:#ff0000;"></span> Rebaixados</span></div><div class="legenda-grupo"><span class="legenda-label"><span class="tabela-icone tabela-icone-positiva"></span> subiu</span><span class="legenda-label"><span class="tabela-icone regulamento</span><div class="disclaimer">
        HORÁRIO DOS JOGOS NA TABELA É LOCAL (1 HORA A MENOS QUE O HORÁRIO DE BRASÍLIA) ATÉ 18/02.
    </div></footer><aside class="lista-de-jogos lista-de-jogos-fora-grupo" <span class="placar-jogo-informacoes-local">Colosso dos Tapajós</span> 18:00</div><div class="placar-jogo-equipes"><span class="placar-jogo-equipes-item placar-jogo-equipes-mandante" itemprop="performer" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/SportsTeam"><meta itemprop="name" content="São Francisco-PA"><span class="placar-jogo-equipes-sigla" title="São Francisco-PA">SFR</span><span class="placar-jogo-equipes-nome">São Francisco-PA</span><img class="placar-jogo-equipes-escudo-mandante" itemprop="image" itemprop="image" placar-jogo-equipes-placar"><span class="placar-jogo-equipes-placar-mandante"></span><span class="tabela-icone tabela-icone-versus"></span><span class="placar-jogo-equipes-placar-visitante"></span></span><span class="placar-jogo-equipes-item placar-jogo-equipes-visitante" itemprop="performer" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/SportsTeam"><meta itemprop="name" content="Cametá"><img class="placar-jogo-equipes-escudo-visitante" itemprop="image" src="http://s.glbimg.com/es/sde/f/organizacoes/2011/03/27/cameta65x65.png" width="30" height="30" title="Cametá"><span class="placar-jogo-equipes-sigla" title="Cametá">CAM</span><span class="placar-jogo-equipes-nome">Cametá</span></span></div></div></li></ul></aside><script type="text/template" id="tabela-regulamento-texto-js">
    As 10 equipes vão compor dois grupos na primeira fase, quando jogam contra os adversários do outro grupo em dois turnos. Na fase classificatória, em caso de igualdade na pontuação, são critérios de desempate: 1) mais vitórias; 2) melhor saldo de gols; 3) mais gols pró; 4) sorteio. Os dois melhores de cada grupo se enfrentam nas semifinais em jogos de ida e volta. Os vencedores das semis decidem o título, enquanto os perdedores duelam pelo terceiro lugar. Nos jogos mata-mata, em caso de empate em pontos e saldo de gols, a vaga ou título serão decididos nas disputas de pênalti. O último colocado de cada grupo após a fase classificatória será rebaixado. Os três primeiros garantem vaga na Copa do Brasil 2018. Para a Série D do Brasileiro, irão os três melhores excetuando Paysandu e Remo, que disputam divisões superiores do campeonato. O campeão estadual jogará a Copa Verde 2018, para o qual outros dois clubes serão indicados de acordo com diretrizes da CBF.
</script></article></div>
</div></div></div><div class="row show-for-medium-up"><div class="column

    var glb_realtime_map = {
        site: 'globoesporte',
        categories: ['home'],
        url: 'http://globoesporte.globo.com/pa/futebol/campeonato-paraense/'
    };

    var realtime = function(realtimeLoaded, msg){
        if(realtimeLoaded){
            return;
        }

        $.getScript('http://s.glbimg.com/bu/rt/js/glb-rt.js', function(){
            $.ajax({
                dataType: 'jsonp',
                
                url: 'http://s.glbimg.com/es/ge/static/live/globoesporte/json/globoesporte-home-agregador.js',
                
                jsonpCallback: 'glbrealtime_callback',
                cache: true,
                success: function(json){
                    $.glbrealtime({
                        data: json,
                        debug: false
                    });
                }
            });
        });
    }

    var realtimeLoaded = false;

    $(window).on('load', function(){
        realtime(realtimeLoaded, "onLoad");
        realtimeLoaded = true;
    })

    setTimeout(function(){
        realtime(realtimeLoaded, "timeout")
        realtimeLoaded = true;
    }, 3000);

</script><link rel="stylesheet"
                  media="screen"
                  href="//s.glbimg.com/gl/ba/css/barra-globocom.min.css"

data-reactid="28">{"@context":"http://schema.org","@type":"NewsArticle","mainEntityOfPage":{"@type":"WebPage","@id":"http://time.com/4710456/donald-trump-time-interview-truth-falsehood/"},"headline":"Read President Trump&#x27;s Interview With TIME on Truth and Falsehoods","url":"http://time.com/4710456/donald-trump-time-interview-truth-falsehood/","dateCreated":"2017-03-23T10:20:58","datePublished":"2017-03-23T10:20:58","dateModified":"2017-03-23T21:33:00","creator":["TIME Staff"],"keywords":["anthony-weiner","barack-obama","congress","devin-nunes","donald-trump","fbi","huma-abedin","james-comey","mike-rogers","national-security-agency"],"author":["TIME Staff"],"publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Time","logo":{"@type":"ImageObject","url":"http://assets.time.com/brandlogos/time.png","height":42,"width":128}},"articleBody":"President Trump spoke with TIME Washington Bureau Chief Michael Scherer on March 22 for a cover story about the way he has handled truth and falsehood in his career. This is a transcript of the exchange, with some minor edits. The transcript does not include requests he made of his staff during the interview, or a comment he made after asking to go off the record. PRESIDENT TRUMP: Hey, Michael. TIME: Hey Mr. President, Thank you for taking the time. Absolutely. How have you been, OK? Yeah, it has been a wild couple months. You keep us busy. Yeah, it&rsquo;s been good though. It&rsquo;s been good. Do you want me to give you a quick overview [of the story]? Yeah, it&rsquo;s a cool story. I mean it&rsquo;s, the concept is right. I predicted a lot of things, Michael. Some things that came to you a little bit later. But, you know, we just rolled out a list. Sweden. I make the statement, everyone goes crazy. The next day they have a massive riot, and death, and problems. Huma [Abedin] and Anthony [Weiner], you know, what I tweeted about that whole deal, and then it turned out he had it, all of Hillary&rsquo;s email on his thing. NATO, obsolete, because it doesn&rsquo;t cover terrorism. They fixed that, and I said that the allies must pay. Nobody knew that they weren&rsquo;t paying. I did. I figured it. Brexit, I was totally right about that. You were over there I think, when I predicted that, right, the day before. Brussels, I said, Brussels is not Brussels. I mean many other things, the election&rsquo;s rigged against Bernie Sanders. We have a lot of things. Read More: Can President Trump Handle the Truth? But there&rsquo;s other things you said that haven&rsquo;t panned out. The peg for this story is the wiretapping hearing on Monday, in which [FBI Director James] Comey and [NSA Director Mike] Rogers testified about your tweets there. Yeah well if you&rsquo;d look at, in fact I&rsquo;ll give you the front page story, and just today I heard, just a little while ago, that Devin Nunes had a news conference, did you hear about this, where they have a lot of information on tapping. Did you hear about that? I have not, no. Now remember this. When I said wiretapping, it was in quotes. Because a wiretapping is, you know today it is different than wire tapping. It is just a good description. But wiretapping was in quotes. What I&rsquo;m talking about is surveillance. And today, [House Intelligence Committee Chairman] Devin Nunes just had a news conference. Now probably got obliterated by what&rsquo;s happened in London. But just had a news conference, and here it is one of those things. The other one, election, I said we are going to win, we won. And many other things. And I think this is going to be very interesting. So you don&rsquo;t feel like Comey&rsquo;s testimony in any way takes away from the credibility of the tweets you put out, even with the quotes? No, I have, look. I have articles saying it happened. But you have to take a look at what they, they just went out at a news conference. Devin Nunes had a news conference. I mean I don&rsquo;t know, I was unable to see it, because I am at meetings, but they just had a news conference talking about surveillance. Now again, it is in quotes. That means surveillance and various other things. And the New York Times had a front-page story, which they actually reduced, they took it, they took it the word wiretapping out of the title, but its first story in the front page of the paper was wiretapping. And a lot of information has just been learned, and a lot of information may be learned over the next coming period of time. We will see what happens. Look. I predicted a lot of things that took a little of bit of time. Here, headline, for the front page of the New York Times, &#8220;Wiretapped data used in inquiry of Trump aides.&#8221; That&rsquo;s a headline. Now they then dropped that headline, I never saw this until this morning. They then dropped that headline, and they used another headline without the word wiretap, but they did mean wiretap. Wiretapped data used in inquiry. Then changed after that, they probably didn&rsquo;t like it. And they changed the title. They took the wiretap word out. One of my ideas here is that throughout the campaign and now as president, you have used disputed statements, this is one of them that is disputed, the claim that three million undocumented people voted in the election&hellip; Well I think I will be proved right about that too. The claim that Muslims celebrated on 9-11 in New Jersey&hellip; Well if you look at the reporter, he wrote the story in the Washington Post. But my idea is that whatever the reality of what you are describing, the fact that they are disputed makes them a more effective message, that you are able to spread the message further, that more people get excited about it, that it gets on TV. Well now if you take a look at the votes, when I say that, I mean mostly they register wrong, in other words, for the votes, they register incorrectly, and/or illegally. And they then vote. You have tremendous numbers of people. In fact I&rsquo;m forming a committee on it. But there&rsquo;s no evidence that 3 million people voted with&hellip; We&rsquo;ll see after the committee. I have people say it was more than that. We will see after we have. But there will be, we are forming a committee. And we are going to do a study on it, a very serious problem. Is there anything different about making these kinds of predictions without having the factual evidence as President? I&rsquo;m a very instinctual person, but my instinct turns out to be right. When everyone said I wasn&rsquo;t going to win the election, I said well I think I would. You know it is interesting, somebody came up to me and said the other day, gee whiz, the New York Times and other people, you know other groups, had you down at one percent, well, I said no I think I am going to win, and people smiled, George Stephanopoulos laughed, you remember. He thought it was very cute, and very funny. Other people smiled. And some people, the smart people or the people that know me didn&rsquo;t laugh at all. There are people that know me, like Carl Icahn and many others, that didn&rsquo;t laugh at all, they thought I was going to win, because they understand how I, they understand me. They get it. But you take a look and guess what, I won, and I won easily. I predicted Brexit. Remember they said there was no way to get to 270? Well I ended up at 306. I had election night, 306. But there was no way to get to, in fact I went to Maine four times, four times I went to Maine, because I had to get one vote, because there was no way to get to 270, but I ended up getting to 306. Brexit, I predicted Brexit, you remember that, the day before the event. I said, no, Brexit is going to happen, and everybody laughed, and Brexit happened. Many many things. They turn out to be right. And now today, Devin Nunes, just had a news conference. I&rsquo;ll look that up. Yeah, just had it. Now the problem, the thing is, I&rsquo;m not sure they are watching anything other than that, let&rsquo;s see members of Donald Trump transition team, possibly, oh this just came out. This is a Politico story. Members of the Donald Trump Transition team possibly including Trump himself were under surveillance during the Obama administration following November&rsquo;s election. House intelligence chairman Devin Nunes told reporters, wow. Nunes said, so that means I&rsquo;m right, Nunes said the surveillance appears to have been &#8230; incidental collection, that does not appear to have been related to concerns over Russia. But so incidental collection would not be wiretapping of you, it would be wiretapping of&hellip; Who knows what it is? You know, why, because somebody says incidental. Nunes is going to the White House. Nunes has also said that he has no evidence that your tweet was right, previously. Well, he just got this information. This was new information. That was just got. Members, of, let&rsquo;s see, were under surveillance during the Obama Administration following November&rsquo;s election. Wow. This just came out. So, ah, just came out. Mitch McConnell has said he&rsquo;d rather you stop tweeting, that he sees it as a distraction. Mitch will speak for himself. Mitch is a wonderful man. Mitch should speak for himself. But you don&rsquo;t see any problems caused by these kinds of controversies. Does this, when we are talking in the press about whether the president was wiretapped or not, is this good for you or bad for you? Probably neither. Probably neither. What I said, look I said, Donna Brazile had information, and she had information on Hillary&rsquo;s debate questions. I said why didn&rsquo;t Hillary apologize. Donna Brazile just admitted that that was right. I said the election was rigged against Bernie, a lot of people agree with that one, a lot of people hated the statement when I made it. But I grant you some of those. But you would agree also that some of the things you have said haven&rsquo;t been true. You say that Ted Cruz&rsquo;s father was with Lee Harvey Oswald. Well that was in a newspaper. No, no, I like Ted Cruz, he&rsquo;s a friend of mine. But that was in the newspaper. I wasn&rsquo;t, I didn&rsquo;t say that. I was referring to a newspaper. A Ted Cruz article referred to a newspaper story with, had a picture of Ted Cruz, his father, and Lee Harvey Oswald, having breakfast. That gets close to the heart&hellip; Why do you say that I have to apologize? I&rsquo;m just quoting the newspaper, just like I quoted the judge the other day, Judge Napolitano, I quoted Judge Napolitano, just like I quoted Bret Baier, I mean Bret Baier mentioned the word wiretap. Now he can now deny it, or whatever he is doing, you know. But I watched Bret Baier, and he used that term. I have a lot of respect for Judge Napolitano, and he said that three sources have told him things that would make me right. I don&rsquo;t know where he has gone with it since then. But I&rsquo;m quoting highly respected people from highly respected television networks. But traditionally people in your position in the Oval Office have not said things unless they can verify they are true. Well, I&rsquo;m not, well, I think, I&rsquo;m not saying, I&rsquo;m quoting, Michael, I&rsquo;m quoting highly respected people and sources from major television networks. Did you see the Wall Street Journal opinion page today, the editorial page? I thought it was, I thought it was a disgrace that they could write that. But let me just, the hypothetical they started with, you have to announce to the country or to the world that some serious national security event has happened, and&hellip; The country believes me. Hey. I went to Kentucky two nights ago, we had 25,000 people in a massive basketball arena. There wasn&rsquo;t a seat, they had to send away people. I went to Tennessee four nights ago. We had a packed house, they had to send away thousands of people. You saw that, right. Did you see that? Yes I did. The country&rsquo;s not buying it, it is fake media. And the Wall Street Journal is a part of it. Ok. So you don&rsquo;t worry that your credibility, that if you&rsquo;ve cited things that later turn out to be wrong, based on anonymous sources that that hurts you. Name what&rsquo;s wrong! I mean, honestly. Fox News said&hellip; Brexit. Wait a minute. I predicted Brexit. What I said about NATO was true, people aren&rsquo;t paying their bills. And everyone said it was a horrible thing to say. And then they found out. And when Germany was over here I said, we are going to have a great relationship with Germany but you have to pay your NATO bills, and they don&rsquo;t even dispute it, ok. So what have I said that is wrong? Everyone, I got attacked on NATO and now they are all saying I was right. I got attacked on Brexit, when I was saying, I said long before the day before, I said the day before the opening, but I was saying Brexit was going to pass, and everybody was laughing, and I turned out to be right on that. I took a lot of heat when I said Brexit was going to pass. Don&rsquo;t forget, Obama said that U.K. will go to the back of the line, and I talked about Sweden, and may have been somewhat different, but the following day, two days later, they had a massive riot in Sweden, exactly what I was talking about, I was right about that. But even in that Sweden quote, you said look at what happened on Friday in Sweden. But you are now saying you were referring to something that happened the following day. No I am saying I was right. I am talking about Sweden. I&rsquo;m talking about what Sweden has done to themselves is very sad, that is what I am talking about. That is what I am talking about. You can phrase it any way you want. A day later they had a horrible, horrible riot in Sweden and you saw what happened. I talked about Brussels. I was on the front page of the New York Times for my quote. I said Brussels is not what it used to be, very sad what has happened to Brussels. I was absolutely lambasted. A short time later they had the major attack in Brussels. One year ago today. Exactly one year ago today. And then people said you know Trump was right. What am I going to tell you? I tend to be right. I&rsquo;m an instinctual person, I happen to be a person that knows how life works. I said I was going to win the election, I won the election, in fact I was number one the entire route, in the primaries, from the day I announced, I was number one. And the New York Times and CNN and all of them, they did these polls, which were extremely bad and they turned out to be totally wrong, and my polls showed I was going to win. We thought we were going to win the night of the election. So when you&hellip; And then TIME magazine, which treats me horribly, but obviously I sell, I assume this is going to be a cover too, have I set the record? I guess, right? Covers, nobody&rsquo;s had more covers. I think Richard Nixon still has you beat. But he was in office for longer, so give yourself time. Ok good. I&rsquo;m sure I&rsquo;ll win. If you go back to Comey testifying that he and the Justice Department have no information to back up your tweet, the head of the NSA testifying that there is no information to back up your tweet, or the claim made by Judge Napolitano&hellip; On front page of the New York Times, OK? It&rsquo;s in the title of the front page. And I would like you to officially&mdash;I know you are going to write a bad article because you always do&mdash;[mention] wiretap data used in inquiry of Trump aides. OK. Wiretapped data used in inquiry of Trump aids. Ok? Can you possibly put that down? Front page, January 20th. Now in their second editions, they took it all down under the internet. They took that out. Ok? But that&rsquo;s the way it is. And then they just had a news conference now where they turned out, you watch. You watch. That is different&hellip; I&rsquo;m not criticizing anybody, I&rsquo;m just saying. That is different than the president wiretapping you which would be a crime outside of a court. Well I don&rsquo;t know where these wiretaps came from. They came from someplace. That is what they should find out. And you know the real story here is about the leakers. OK? You don&rsquo;t write about that. But the real story here is, who released General Flynn&rsquo;s name? Who released, who released my conversations with Australia, and who released my conversation with Mexico? To me, Michael, that&rsquo;s the story, these leakers, they are disgusting. These are horrible people. And apparently there is an investigation into that as well. Well should be, because that&rsquo;s where the whole, who would think that you are speaking to the head of Mexico, the head of Australia, or General Flynn, who was, they are not supposed to release that. That is the most confidential stuff. Classified. That&rsquo;s classified. You go to prison when you release stuff like that. And who would release that? The real story is, they have to work, intelligence has to work on finding out who are the leakers. Because you know what? When things get involved with North Korea and all the problems we have there, in the Middle East, I mean, that information cannot be leaked out, and it will be by this, this same, and these people were here in the Obama years, because he had plenty of leakers also. But intelligence has to find out, who are these people. Because the biggest story here is, who is leaking this classified information. But isn&rsquo;t there, it strikes me there is still an issue of credibility. If the intelligence community came out and said, we have determined that so and so is the leaker here, but you are saying to me now, that you don&rsquo;t believe the intelligence community when they say your tweet was wrong. I&rsquo;m not saying&mdash;no, I&rsquo;m not blaming. First of all, I put Mike Pompeo in. I put Senator Dan Coats in. These are great people. I think they are great people and they are going to, I have a lot of confidence in them. So hopefully things will straighten out. But I inherited a mess, I inherited a mess in so many ways. I inherited a mess in the Middle East, and a mess with North Korea, I inherited a mess with jobs, despite the statistics, you know, my statistics are even better, but they are not the real statistics because you have millions of people that can&rsquo;t get a job, ok. And I inherited a mess on trade. I mean we have many, you can go up and down the ladder. But that&rsquo;s the story. Hey look, in the mean time, I guess, I can&rsquo;t be doing so badly, because I&rsquo;m president, and you&rsquo;re not. You know. Say hello to everybody OK? Thank you very much, Mr. President.","articleSection":"Politics","image":{"@type":"ImageObject","url":"https://timedotcom.files.wordpress.com/2017/03/donald-trump-truth-falsehood-time-interview.jpg?quality=85"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://timedotcom.files.wordpress.com/2017/03/donald-trump-truth-falsehood-time-interview.jpg?quality=85"}</script><script data-reactid="211"><p class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2  text size-1x-large line-height-large _10M0Ygc4" data-reactid="212"><!-- react-text: 213 -->President Trump spoke with TIME Washington Bureau Chief Michael Scherer on March 22 for <!-- /react-text --><a href="/4710614/donald-trump-fbi-surveillance-house-intelligence-committee/" data-reactid="214"><!-- react-text: 215 -->a cover story about the way he has handled truth and falsehood<!-- /react-text --></a><!-- react-text: 216 --> in his career.<!-- /react-text --></p><p class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2  text size-1x-large line-height-large _10M0Ygc4" data-reactid="217"><!-- react-text: 218 -->This is a transcript of the exchange, with some minor edits. The transcript does not include requests he made of his staff during the interview, or a comment he made after asking to go off the record.<!-- /react-text --></p><p class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2  text size-1x-large line-height-large _10M0Ygc4" data-reactid="219"><!-- react-text: 220 -->PRESIDENT TRUMP: Hey, Michael.<!-- /react-text --></p><p class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2  text size-1x-large line-height-large _10M0Ygc4" data-reactid="221"><strong data-reactid="222">TIME: Hey Mr. President, Thank you for taking the time.</strong></p><p class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2  text size-1x-large line-height-large _10M0Ygc4" data-reactid="223"><!-- react-text: 224 -->Absolutely. How have you been, OK?<!-- /react-text --></p><p class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2  text size-1x-large line-height-large _10M0Ygc4" data-reactid="225"><strong data-reactid="226">Yeah, it has been a wild couple months. You keep us busy.</strong></p><p class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2  text size-1x-large line-height-large _10M0Ygc4" data-reactid="227"><!-- react-text: 228 -->Yeah, its been good though. Its been good.<!-- /react-text --></p><p class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2  text size-1x-large line-height-large _10M0Ygc4" data-reactid="229"><strong data-reactid="230">Do you want me to give you a quick overview [of the story]?</strong></p><p class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2  text size-1x-large line-height-large _10M0Ygc4" data-reactid="231"><!-- react-text: 232 -->Yeah, its a cool story. I mean its, the concept is right. I predicted a lot of things, Michael. Some things that came to you a little bit later. But, you know, we just rolled out a list. Sweden. <!-- /react-text --><a href="/4676133/white-house-donald-trump-sweden/" data-reactid="233"><!-- react-text: 234 -->I make the statement, everyone goes crazy<!-- /react-text --></a><!-- react-text: 235 -->. The next day they have a massive riot, and death, and problems. Huma [Abedin] and Anthony [Weiner], you know, what I tweeted about that whole deal, and then it turned out he had it, <!-- /react-text --><a href="/4556850/donald-trump-ad-anthony-weiner-pervert/" data-reactid="236"><!-- react-text: 237 -->all of Hillarys email on his thing<!-- /react-text --></a><!-- react-text: 238 -->. <!-- /react-text --><a href="/4635720/donald-trump-interview-nato-russia-sanctions-brexit/" data-reactid="239"><!-- react-text: 240 -->NATO, obsolete<!-- /react-text --></a><!-- react-text: 241 -->, because it doesnt cover terrorism. They fixed that, and I said that the allies must pay. Nobody knew that they werent paying. I did. I figured it. <!-- /react-text --><a href="/4382526/brexit-hillary-clinton-donald-trump-populism/" data-reactid="242"><!-- react-text: 243 -->Brexit, I was totally right about that<!-- /react-text --></a><!-- react-text: 244 -->. You were over there I think, when I predicted that, right, the day before. Brussels, I said, Brussels is not Brussels. I mean many other things, <!-- /react-text --><a href="/4433984/donald-trump-general-election-rigged/" data-reactid="245"><!-- react-text: 246 -->the elections rigged<!-- /react-text --></a><!-- react-text: 247 --> against Bernie Sanders. We have a lot of things.<!-- /react-text --></p><p class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2  text size-1x-large line-height-large _10M0Ygc4" data-reactid="248"><strong data-reactid="249">Read More:</strong><!-- react-text: 250 --> <!-- /react-text --><a href="/4710614/donald-trump-fbi-surveillance-house-intelligence-committee/" data-reactid="251"><em data-reactid="252">Can President Trump Handle the Truth?</em></a></p><p class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2  text size-1x-large line-height-large _10M0Ygc4" data-reactid="253"><strong data-reactid="254"><!-- react-text: 255 -->But theres other things you said that havent panned out. The peg for this story is the wiretapping hearing on Monday, in which [FBI Director James] Comey and [NSA Director Mike] Rogers <!-- /react-text --><a href="/4706646/fbi-russia-james-comey-testimony/" data-reactid="256"><!-- react-text: 257 -->testified<!-- /react-text --></a><!-- react-text: 258 --> about your tweets there. <!-- /react-text --></strong></p><p class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2  text size-1x-large line-height-large _10M0Ygc4" data-reactid="259"><!-- react-text: 260 -->Yeah well if youd look at, in fact Ill give you the front page story, and just today I heard, just a little while ago, that <!-- /react-text --><a href="/4709443/devin-nunes-trump-transition-intelligence/" data-reactid="261"><!-- react-text: 262 -->Devin Nunes had a news conference<!-- /react-text --></a><!-- react-text: 263 -->, did you hear about this, where they have a lot of information on tapping. Did you hear about that?<!-- /react-text --></p><div class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2 " style="padding:0 0 20px;" data-reactid="264"><div class="brightcove-wrapper dont-print" data-reactid="265"><!-- react-empty: 266 --><div data-reactid="267"></div></div></div><p class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2  text size-1x-large line-height-large _10M0Ygc4" data-reactid="268"><strong data-reactid="269">I have not, no.</strong></p><p class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2  text size-1x-large line-height-large _10M0Ygc4" data-reactid="270"><!-- react-text: 271 -->Now remember this. When I said wiretapping, it was in quotes. Because a wiretapping is, you know today it is different than wire tapping. It is just a good description. But wiretapping was in quotes. What Im talking about is surveillance. And today, [House Intelligence Committee Chairman] Devin Nunes just had a news conference. Now probably got obliterated by <!-- /react-text --><a href="/4709244/london-attack-parliament-what-to-know/" data-reactid="272"><!-- react-text: 273 -->whats happened in London<!-- /react-text --></a><!-- react-text: 274 -->. But just had a news conference, and here it is one of those things. The other one, election, I said we are going to win, we won. And many other things. And I think this is going to be very interesting.<!-- /react-text --></p><p class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2  text size-1x-large line-height-large _10M0Ygc4" data-reactid="275"><strong data-reactid="276">So you dont feel like Comeys testimony in any way takes away from the credibility of the tweets you put out, even with the quotes? </strong></p><p class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2  text size-1x-large line-height-large _10M0Ygc4" data-reactid="277"><!-- react-text: 278 -->No, I have, look. I have articles saying it happened. But you have to take a look at what they, they just went out at a news conference. Devin Nunes had a news conference. I mean I dont know, I was unable to see it, because I am at meetings, but they just had a news conference talking about surveillance. Now again, it is in quotes. That means surveillance and various other things. And the New York <!-- /react-text --><em data-reactid="279">Times</em><!-- react-text: 280 --> had a front-page story, which they actually reduced, they took it, they took it the word wiretapping out of the title, but its first story in the front page of the paper was wiretapping. And a lot of information has just been learned, and a lot of information may be learned over the next coming period of time. We will see what happens. Look. I predicted a lot of things that took a little of bit of time. Here, headline, for the front page of the New York <!-- /react-text --><em data-reactid="281">Times</em><!-- react-text: 282 -->, &quot;Wiretapped data used in inquiry of Trump aides.&quot; Thats a headline. Now they then dropped that headline, I never saw this until this morning. They then dropped that headline, and they used another headline without the word wiretap, but they did mean wiretap. Wiretapped data used in inquiry. Then changed after that, they probably didnt like it. And they changed the title. They took the wiretap word out.<!-- /react-text --></p><div class="column small-12 large-11 large-offset-1" data-reactid="283"><h3 class="_1lfmFI9X" data-reactid="284"><!-- react-text: 285 --> <!-- /react-text --><!-- react-text: 286 -->20 Photographs That Show the Essential Donald Trump<!-- /react-text --><!-- react-text: 287 --> <!-- /react-text --></h3><figure class="_3FJB9EFr" data-reactid="288"><div class="_2PkKH9az" data-reactid="289"><img src="https://timedotcom.files.wordpress.com/2016/07/trump_benson_time_0001.jpg?quality=85&amp;w=397" srcset="https://timedotcom.files.wordpress.com/2016/07/trump_benson_time_0001.jpg?quality=85&amp;w=821 1x, https://timedotcom.files.wordpress.com/2016/07/trump_benson_time_0001.jpg?quality=85&amp;w=1586 2x" alt="1981 Trump talks on a car phone in a limo in New York City. It looks like hes running for President in there, Benson said. Theres a bit of control there ... People walking about but hes in the limo." data-reactid="290"/></div><div class="_137FDtVa" data-reactid="291"><!-- react-text: 292 -->VIEW GALLERY | <!-- /react-text --><!-- react-text: 293 -->20<!-- /react-text --><!-- react-text: 294 --> PHOTOS<!-- /react-text --></div><figcaption data-reactid="295"><span style="display:none;" data-reactid="296">1981 Trump talks on a car phone in a limo in New York City. It looks like hes running for President in there, Benson said. Theres a bit of control there ... Wait a minute. I predicted Brexit. What I said about NATO was true, people arent paying their bills. And everyone said it was a horrible thing to say. And then they found out. And when Germany was over here I said, we are going to have a great relationship with Germany but you have to pay your NATO bills, and they dont even dispute it, ok. So what have I said that is wrong? Everyone, I got attacked on NATO and now they are all saying I was right. I got attacked on Brexit, when I was saying, I said long before the day before, I said the day before the opening, but I was saying Brexit was going to pass, and everybody was laughing, and I turned out to be right on that. I took a lot of heat when I said Brexit was going to pass. Dont forget, Obama said that U.K. will go to the back of the line, and I talked about Sweden, and may have been somewhat different, but the following day, two days later, they had a massive riot in Sweden, exactly what I was talking about, I was right about that.<!-- /react-text --></p><p class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2  text size-1x-large line-height-large _10M0Ygc4" data-reactid="635"><strong data-reactid="636">But even in that Sweden quote, you said look at what happened on Friday in Sweden. I am talking about Sweden. Im talking about what Sweden has done to themselves is very sad, that is what I am talking about. That is what I am talking about. You can phrase it any way you want. A day later they had a horrible, horrible riot in Sweden and you saw what happened. I talked about Brussels. I was on the front page of the New York <!-- /react-text --><em data-reactid="639">Times</em><!-- react-text: 640 --> for my quote. I said Brussels is not what it used to be, very sad what has happened to Brussels. I was absolutely lambasted. A short time later they had the major attack in Brussels. One year ago today. Exactly one year ago today. And then people said you know Trump was right. What am I going to tell you? I tend to be right. Im an instinctual person, I happen to be a person that knows how life works. I said I was going to win the election, I won the election, in fact I was number one the entire route, in the primaries, from the day I announced, I was number one. And the New York <!-- /react-text --><em data-reactid="641">Times</em><!-- react-text: 642 --> and CNN and all of them, they did these polls, which were extremely bad and they turned out to be totally wrong, and my polls showed I was going to win. We thought we were going to win the night of the election.<!-- /react-text --></p><p class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2  text size-1x-large line-height-large _10M0Ygc4" data-reactid="643"><strong data-reactid="644">So when you</strong></p><p class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2  text size-1x-large line-height-large _10M0Ygc4" data-reactid="645"><!-- react-text: 646 -->And then TIME magazine, which treats me horribly, but obviously I sell, I assume this is going to be a cover too, have I set the record? I guess, right? Covers, nobodys had more covers.<!-- /react-text --></p><p class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2  text size-1x-large line-height-large _10M0Ygc4" data-reactid="647"><strong data-reactid="648"><!-- react-text: 649 -->I think <!-- /react-text --><a target="_blank" href="http://nation.time.com/2013/11/06/10-things-you-didnt-know-about-time/" data-reactid="650"><!-- react-text: 651 -->Richard Nixon still has you beat<!-- /react-text --></a><!-- react-text: 652 -->. Im sure Ill win.<!-- /react-text --></p><p class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2  text size-1x-large line-height-large _10M0Ygc4" data-reactid="655"><strong data-reactid="656">If you go back to Comey testifying that he and the Justice Department have no information to back up your tweet, the head of the NSA testifying that there is no information to back up your tweet, or the claim made by Judge Napolitano </strong></p><p class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2  text size-1x-large line-height-large _10M0Ygc4" data-reactid="657"><!-- react-text: 658 -->On front page of the New York <!-- /react-text --><em data-reactid="659">Times</em><!-- react-text: 660 -->, OK? Its in the title of the front page. And I would like you to officiallyI know you are going to write a bad article because you always do[mention] wiretap data used in inquiry of Trump aides. OK. Wiretapped data used in inquiry of Trump aids. Ok? Can you possibly put that down? Front page, January 20th. Now in their second editions, they took it all down under the internet. They took that out. Ok? But thats the way it is. And then they just had a news conference now where they turned out, you watch. You watch.<!-- /react-text --></p><p class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2  text size-1x-large line-height-large _10M0Ygc4" data-reactid="661"><strong data-reactid="662">That is different</strong></p><p class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2  text size-1x-large line-height-large _10M0Ygc4" data-reactid="663"><!-- react-text: 664 -->Im not criticizing anybody, Im just saying.<!-- /react-text --></p><p class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2  text size-1x-large line-height-large _10M0Ygc4" data-reactid="665"><strong data-reactid="666">That is different than the president wiretapping you which would be a crime outside of a court. </strong></p><p class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2  text size-1x-large line-height-large _10M0Ygc4" data-reactid="667"><!-- react-text: 668 -->Well I dont know where these wiretaps came from. They came from someplace. That is what they should find out. And you know the real story here is about the leakers. OK? You dont write about that. But the real story here is, who released General Flynns name? Who released, who released my conversations with Australia, and who released my conversation with Mexico? To me, Michael, thats the story, these leakers, they are disgusting. These are horrible people.<!-- /react-text --></p><p class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2  text size-1x-large line-height-large _10M0Ygc4" data-reactid="669"><strong data-reactid="670">And apparently there is an investigation into that as well.</strong></p><p class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2  text size-1x-large line-height-large _10M0Ygc4" data-reactid="671"><!-- react-text: 672 -->Well should be, because thats where the whole, who would think that you are speaking to the head of Mexico, the head of Australia, or General Flynn, who was, they are not supposed to release that. That is the most confidential stuff. Classified. Thats classified. You go to prison when you release stuff like that. And who would release that? The real story is, they have to work, intelligence has to work on finding out who are the leakers. Because you know what? When things get involved with North Korea and all the problems we have there, in the Middle East, I mean, that information cannot be leaked out, and it will be by this, this same, and these people were here in the Obama years, because he had plenty of leakers also. But intelligence has to find out, who are these people. Because the biggest story here is, who is leaking this classified information.<!-- /react-text --></p><p class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2  text size-1x-large line-height-large _10M0Ygc4" data-reactid="673"><strong data-reactid="674">But isnt there, it strikes me there is still an issue of credibility. If the intelligence community came out and said, we have determined that so and so is the leaker here, but you are saying to me now, that you dont believe the intelligence community when they say your tweet was wrong. </strong></p><p class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2  text size-1x-large line-height-large _10M0Ygc4" data-reactid="675"><!-- react-text: 676 -->Im not sayingno, Im not blaming. First of all, I put Mike Pompeo in. I put Senator Dan Coats in. These are great people. I think they are great people and they are going to, I have a lot of confidence in them. So hopefully things will straighten out. But I inherited a mess, I inherited a mess in so many ways. I inherited a mess in the Middle East, and a mess with North Korea, I inherited a mess with jobs, despite the statistics, you know, my statistics are even better, but they are not the real statistics because you have millions of people that cant get a job, ok. And I inherited a mess on trade. I mean we have many, you can go up and down the ladder. But thats the story. Hey look, in the mean time, I guess, I cant be doing so badly, because Im president, and youre not. You know. President Trump's Interview With TIME on Truth and Falsehoods"},"content":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EPresident Trump spoke with TIME Washington Bureau Chief Michael Scherer on March 22 for \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4710614\u002Fdonald-trump-fbi-surveillance-house-intelligence-committee\u002F\"\u003Ea cover story about the way he has handled truth and falsehood\u003C\u002Fa\u003E in his career.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThis is a transcript of the exchange, with some minor edits. The transcript does not include requests he made of his staff during the interview, or a comment he made after asking to go off the record.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EPRESIDENT TRUMP: Hey, Michael.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003ETIME: Hey Mr. President, Thank you for taking the time.\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAbsolutely. If the intelligence community came out and said, we have determined that so and so is the leaker here, but you are saying to me now, that you don&rsquo;t believe the intelligence community when they say your tweet was wrong. \u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EI&rsquo;m not saying&mdash;no, I&rsquo;m not blaming. First of all, I put Mike Pompeo in. I put Senator Dan Coats in. These are great people. I think they are great people and they are going to, I have a lot of confidence in them. So hopefully things will straighten out. But I inherited a mess, I inherited a mess in so many ways. I inherited a mess in the Middle East, and a mess with North Korea, I inherited a mess with jobs, despite the statistics, you know, my statistics are even better, but they are not the real statistics because you have millions of people that can&rsquo;t get a job, ok. And I inherited a mess on trade. I mean we have many, you can go up and down the ladder. But that&rsquo;s the story. Hey look, in the mean time, I guess, I can&rsquo;t be doing so badly, because I&rsquo;m president, and you&rsquo;re not. You know. Say hello to everybody OK?"]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":[{"tag":"strong","attributes":[],"content":["Thank you very much, Mr. President. "]}]}],"plain":"President Trump spoke with TIME Washington Bureau Chief Michael Scherer on March 22 for a cover story about the way he has handled truth and falsehood in his career. This is a transcript of the exchange, with some minor edits. The transcript does not include requests he made of his staff during the interview, or a comment he made after asking to go off the record. PRESIDENT TRUMP: Hey, Michael. TIME: Hey Mr. President, Thank you for taking the time. Absolutely. How have you been, OK? Yeah, it has been a wild couple months. You keep us busy. Yeah, it&rsquo;s been good though. It&rsquo;s been good. Do you want me to give you a quick overview [of the story]? Yeah, it&rsquo;s a cool story. I mean it&rsquo;s, the concept is right. I predicted a lot of things, Michael. Some things that came to you a little bit later. But, you know, we just rolled out a list. Sweden. I make the statement, everyone goes crazy. The next day they have a massive riot, and death, and problems. Huma [Abedin] and Anthony [Weiner], you know, what I tweeted about that whole deal, and then it turned out he had it, all of Hillary&rsquo;s email on his thing. NATO, obsolete, because it doesn&rsquo;t cover terrorism. They fixed that, and I said that the allies must pay. Nobody knew that they weren&rsquo;t paying. I did. I figured it. Brexit, I was totally right about that. You were over there I think, when I predicted that, right, the day before. Brussels, I said, Brussels is not Brussels. I mean many other things, the election&rsquo;s rigged against Bernie Sanders. We have a lot of things. Read More: Can President Trump Handle the Truth? But there&rsquo;s other things you said that haven&rsquo;t panned out. The peg for this story is the wiretapping hearing on Monday, in which [FBI Director James] Comey and [NSA Director Mike] Rogers testified about your tweets there. Yeah well if you&rsquo;d look at, in fact I&rsquo;ll give you the front page story, and just today I heard, just a little while ago, that Devin Nunes had a news conference, did you hear about this, where they have a lot of information on tapping. Did you hear about that? I have not, no. Now remember this. When I said wiretapping, it was in quotes. Because a wiretapping is, you know today it is different than wire tapping. It is just a good description. But wiretapping was in quotes. What I&rsquo;m talking about is surveillance. And today, [House Intelligence Committee Chairman] Devin Nunes just had a news conference. Now probably got obliterated by what&rsquo;s happened in London. But just had a news conference, and here it is one of those things. The other one, election, I said we are going to win, we won. And many other things. And I think this is going to be very interesting. So you don&rsquo;t feel like Comey&rsquo;s testimony in any way takes away from the credibility of the tweets you put out, even with the quotes? No, I have, look. I have articles saying it happened. But you have to take a look at what they, they just went out at a news conference. Devin Nunes had a news conference. I mean I don&rsquo;t know, I was unable to see it, because I am at meetings, but they just had a news conference talking about surveillance. Now again, it is in quotes. That means surveillance and various other things. And the New York Times had a front-page story, which they actually reduced, they took it, they took it the word wiretapping out of the title, but its first story in the front page of the paper was wiretapping. And a lot of information has just been learned, and a lot of information may be learned over the next coming period of time. We will see what happens. Look. I predicted a lot of things that took a little of bit of time. Here, headline, for the front page of the New York Times, &#8220;Wiretapped data used in inquiry of Trump aides.&#8221; That&rsquo;s a headline. Now they then dropped that headline, I never saw this until this morning. They then dropped that headline, and they used another headline without the word wiretap, but they did mean wiretap. Wiretapped data used in inquiry. Then changed after that, they probably didn&rsquo;t like it. And they changed the title. They took the wiretap word out. One of my ideas here is that throughout the campaign and now as president, you have used disputed statements, this is one of them that is disputed, the claim that three million undocumented people voted in the election&hellip; Well I think I will be proved right about that too. The claim that Muslims celebrated on 9-11 in New Jersey&hellip; Well if you look at the reporter, he wrote the story in the Washington Post. But my idea is that whatever the reality of what you are describing, the fact that they are disputed makes them a more effective message, that you are able to spread the message further, that more people get excited about it, that it gets on TV. Well now if you take a look at the votes, when I say that, I mean mostly they register wrong, in other words, for the votes, they register incorrectly, and\u002For illegally. And they then vote. You have tremendous numbers of people. In fact I&rsquo;m forming a committee on it. But there&rsquo;s no evidence that 3 million people voted with&hellip; We&rsquo;ll see after the committee. I have people say it was more than that. We will see after we have. But there will be, we are forming a committee. And we are going to do a study on it, a very serious problem. Is there anything different about making these kinds of predictions without having the factual evidence as President? I&rsquo;m a very instinctual person, but my instinct turns out to be right. When everyone said I wasn&rsquo;t going to win the election, I said well I think I would. You know it is interesting, somebody came up to me and said the other day, gee whiz, the New York Times and other people, you know other groups, had you down at one percent, well, I said no I think I am going to win, and people smiled, George Stephanopoulos laughed, you remember. He thought it was very cute, and very funny. Other people smiled. And some people, the smart people or the people that know me didn&rsquo;t laugh at all. There are people that know me, like Carl Icahn and many others, that didn&rsquo;t laugh at all, they thought I was going to win, because they understand how I, they understand me. They get it. But you take a look and guess what, I won, and I won easily. I predicted Brexit. Remember they said there was no way to get to 270? Well I ended up at 306. I had election night, 306. But there was no way to get to, in fact I went to Maine four times, four times I went to Maine, because I had to get one vote, because there was no way to get to 270, but I ended up getting to 306. Brexit, I predicted Brexit, you remember that, the day before the event. I said, no, Brexit is going to happen, and everybody laughed, and Brexit happened. Many many things. They turn out to be right. And now today, Devin Nunes, just had a news conference. I&rsquo;ll look that up. Yeah, just had it. Now the problem, the thing is, I&rsquo;m not sure they are watching anything other than that, let&rsquo;s see members of Donald Trump transition team, possibly, oh this just came out. This is a Politico story. Members of the Donald Trump Transition team possibly including Trump himself were under surveillance during the Obama administration following November&rsquo;s election. House intelligence chairman Devin Nunes told reporters, wow. Nunes said, so that means I&rsquo;m right, Nunes said the surveillance appears to have been &#8230; incidental collection, that does not appear to have been related to concerns over Russia. But so incidental collection would not be wiretapping of you, it would be wiretapping of&hellip; Who knows what it is? You know, why, because somebody says incidental. Nunes is going to the White House. Nunes has also said that he has no evidence that your tweet was right, previously. Well, he just got this information. This was new information. That was just got. But you don&rsquo;t see any problems caused by these kinds of controversies. Does this, when we are talking in the press about whether the president was wiretapped or not, is this good for you or bad for you? Probably neither. Probably neither. What I said, look I said, Donna Brazile had information, and she had information on Hillary&rsquo;s debate questions. I said why didn&rsquo;t Hillary apologize. Donna Brazile just admitted that that was right. I said the election was rigged against Bernie, a lot of people agree with that one, a lot of people hated the statement when I made it. But I grant you some of those. But you would agree also that some of the things you have said haven&rsquo;t been true. You say that Ted Cruz&rsquo;s father was with Lee Harvey Oswald. Well that was in a newspaper. No, no, I like Ted Cruz, he&rsquo;s a friend of mine. But that was in the newspaper. I wasn&rsquo;t, I didn&rsquo;t say that. I was referring to a newspaper. A Ted Cruz article referred to a newspaper story with, had a picture of Ted Cruz, his father, and Lee Harvey Oswald, having breakfast.
